New Records: Ryan Helsley tied the St. Louis Cardinals' franchise record with his 48th save, surpassing Trevor Rosenthal's mark set in 2015. He also set new team records for consecutive saves (31) and saves before the All-Star break (32).
Key Match Events: Ryan Helsley secured the game with a single pitch, inducing a grounder and completing a double play to cap the Cardinals' 5-2 victory over the Colorado Rockies. This marked a turning point in the game, capping a dominant performance by the Cardinals' bullpen.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cardinals' manager Oliver Marmol relied on Helsley's dominance at home, as he had not blown a save at Busch Stadium all season, maintaining a 27-0 record there, which kept the team in playoff contention.
Post-Match Reflections: Ryan Helsley expressed his gratitude for the season's success and emphasized team objectives over personal records, highlighting his commitment to the team's playoff push despite not achieving the record-breaking 49th save.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was a close contest, testing the Cardinals' ability to handle high-pressure situations, which was crucial for their playoff chances.
